text.text: An EPA Regional staff member and a community organizer for environmental justice are working together to convene and activate a new group of community members in a rural county with EJ issues. They decided that their Goals for Going through the ERB Process are:
- Bring together community leaders and members who have not gotten together to discuss EJ issues before and empower/activate them to take action
- Increase community members' knowledge about emergency preparedness
- Identify potential actions for the group to take
A local environmental education and advocacy organization is leading the development of a watershed resilience plan. They decide that their Goals for Going through the ERB Process are:
- Collect input for the resilience plan from community members in the watershed, particularly with a focus on equity issues

- Convene workshops in sub-watersheds to bring together local environmental organizations, neighborhood associations, and other groups who have not worked together before, to help them improve their community engagement.

A county emergency manager is tasked with leading a committee to update the county's Hazard Mitigation Plan. The previous plan has plenty on natural hazards but hasn't incorporated lessons learned from the COVID-19 pandemic. The committee decides that their Goals for Going through the ERB Process are:
- Improve the plan's social vulnerability assessment
- Incorporate pandemics and other biological incidents into the plan
